text: Figure 1. We train a Navigation World Model (NWM) from video footage of robots and their associated navigation actions (a). After training, NWM can evaluate trajectories by synthesizing their videos and scoring the ﬁnal frame’s similarity with the goal (b). We use NWM to plan from scratch or rank experts navigation trajectories, improving downstream visual navigation performance. In unknown environments, NWM can simulate imagined trajectories from a single image (c). In all examples above, the input to the model is the ﬁrst image and actions, then the model auto-regressively synthesizes future observations. Click on the image to view examples in a browser.

Figure 3. Following trajectories in known environments. We include qualitative video generation comparisons of different models following ground truth trajectories. Click on the image to play the video clip in a browser.
Table 1. Ablations of predicted goals per sample number, context size, and the use of action and time conditioning. We report pre- diction results 4 seconds into the future on RECON.
Figure 5. CDiT vs. DiT. Measuring how well models predict 4 seconds into the future on RECON. We report LPIPS as a function of Tera FLOPs, lower is better.

Table 3. Planning with Navigation Constraints. We present results for planning with NWM under three action constraints, reporting the differences in ﬁnal position (ωu) and yaw (ωε) relative to the no-constraints baseline. All constraints are met, demonstrating that NWM can effectively adhere to them.

Fig. 7. Ranking an external policy’s trajectories using NWM. To navigate from the observation image to the goal, we sample trajectories from NoMaD [55], simulate each of these trajectories using NWM, score them (see Equation 4), and rank them. With NWM we can accurately choose trajectories that are closer to the groundtruth trajectory. Click the image to play examples in a browser.
Fig. 4: Gantt chart for the timings (in minutes) for each step necessary for the calculation of CD-CCSD gradients of cc-pVTZ coronene.

Overview of the hierarchical planning framework. The model first predicts high-level waypoints and then refines them into low-level navigation actions. We visualize predicted rollouts alongside ground-truth trajectories to highlight differences in long-horizon behavior.

Although the differences between the two phases are relatively small, they persist and become  more  pronounced  at  higher  temperatures,  indicating  distinct  degrees  of  thermodynamic  stability. As shown in Figure 4, AlSb exhibits a phase transition near 245-250 K. Lower values  of the Helmholtz free energy correspond to a more stable configuration at a given temperature,  which is particularly important  when evaluating materials for high-temperature applications.

The presence of a direct band gap promotes efficient generation and recombination of electron- hole pairs in the studied material. This property enhances both light absorption and  photoluminescence, which are critical for the performance of optoelectronic devices such as  light-emitting diodes (LEDs) and lasers. Moreover, materials with a wide and direct band gap  can  reduce  energy  losses  caused  by  thermal  conductivity  and  enable  stable  operation  of

Traditionally, tequila is made from Blue Weber agave, while mezcal comes from Espadín agave.
Investing in intangible assets is important to more than just Canada’s economic success. They can be a strategic moat, giving us leverage and independence when we need it most.

Canadian workers have always enjoyed less M&E investment than their U.S. counterparts. But investment per available worker by Canadian business was around 60 cents for every dollar invested by U.S. businesses in the 2000s. It fell to the 40-cent range over the past decade and by the second quarter of 2025 registered an anemic 37 cents.

The lack of rebound in oil and gas investment in recent years, despite favourable oil prices, is due to oil companies returning a greater share of their revenues to shareholders rather than investing in their operations

The chart shows that a rising share of incorporated business owners are now sole operators. This highlights a decline in business dynamism and a risk to future job creation given that small firms have historically been a key driver of job growth.
Instead, he focuses on procedures such as radiofrequency ablation (RFA), in which instruments guided by special X-ray imaging generate concentrated blasts of heat that disable nerves.

After revisions to his business plan and further negotiations, he got financing and opened a clinic in downtown Toronto in 2023 while continuing to work as an anesthesiologist at the Scarborough Health Network.

Canadian businesses have struggled to close the investment gap with their global peers, particularly in areas such as machinery, equipment, and intellectual property. While investment rebounded modestly following the pandemic, it has failed to keep pace with rising labor costs and international competition. Economists warn that without sustained capital investment, productivity growth will remain sluggish.

Although commodity prices have remained relatively strong, energy companies have been reluctant to significantly expand production. Instead, firms have prioritized shareholder returns through dividends and buybacks, reflecting lingering uncertainty about long-term demand and regulatory pressures. This shift has raised concerns about future supply capacity.

Health-care providers across the country are increasingly turning to specialized outpatient clinics to reduce pressure on hospitals. These facilities focus on targeted procedures that can be completed quickly, allowing patients to return home the same day. Advocates say the approach improves efficiency, though critics worry about uneven access.

The rise in sole proprietorships has altered the structure of the labor market in subtle but important ways. While entrepreneurship rates appear healthy on paper, many of these businesses employ no additional workers. Analysts argue this trend may limit job creation and dampen wage growth over time.

After several rounds of negotiations, the company secured private financing to fund its expansion plans. The new capital allowed management to proceed with opening additional locations while maintaining existing operations. Executives say the deal provides stability in an otherwise volatile market.

Agricultural producers have begun experimenting with alternative crops as climate conditions shift. In some regions, farmers are replacing traditional staples with more drought-resistant varieties. These changes reflect broader efforts to adapt to increasingly unpredictable growing seasons.

Despite advances in medical imaging and minimally invasive treatments, access to specialized care remains uneven. Patients in smaller communities often travel long distances for procedures that are readily available in major cities. Policymakers have identified this disparity as a growing concern.

Economists note that while headline growth figures remain positive, underlying indicators suggest weakening momentum. Business confidence surveys show firms becoming more cautious about hiring and capital spending. This hesitation could weigh on economic performance in the coming quarters.

The company’s decision to delay its product launch was influenced by supply chain disruptions and rising input costs. Executives emphasized the importance of maintaining quality standards rather than rushing to market. Investors responded cautiously to the announcement.

Over the past decade, investment in research and development has become increasingly concentrated among a small number of large firms. Smaller companies often lack the resources to sustain long-term innovation efforts. This imbalance may reduce competitive pressure and slow technological diffusion.

Rural communities continue to face challenges attracting and retaining skilled professionals. Limited infrastructure and fewer employment opportunities for spouses are often cited as key barriers. Some regions are experimenting with incentive programs to address the issue.

While consumer spending has held up better than expected, households are becoming more selective in their purchases. Higher interest rates have increased debt servicing costs, leaving less disposable income. Retailers are adjusting their strategies accordingly.

The clinic’s expansion followed months of regulatory review and internal planning. Management opted to focus on a narrow range of procedures to maximize efficiency. The model has since drawn interest from other practitioners considering similar ventures.

Analysts point out that productivity gains from digital adoption are not evenly distributed across sectors. Industries with complex legacy systems often face higher transition costs. As a result, the benefits of new technologies can take years to materialize.

Public infrastructure projects have been delayed by rising construction costs and labor shortages. Municipal governments are reassessing timelines and budgets as a result. In some cases, projects have been scaled back to remain financially viable.
Alphabet Inc. reported stable revenue growth during the quarter, driven largely by continued demand for digital advertising and cloud services.
